alert.note: Alert for Broadwater; Gallatin; Meagher (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 04 at 5:12PM MDT by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Broadwater, west central Meagher and northern Gallatin Counties through 600 PM MDT... At 508 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Townsend, moving northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The brief heavy rainfall may also cause minor debris flow out of the Big Belt Mountains as it moves over the Deep Creek burn scar area. However, this rainfall will likely NOT be heavy enough to cause significant flooding. Locations impacted include... Townsend, Toston and Fort Logan. This includes Highway 12 between mile markers 1 and 14, and between mile markers 77 and 88. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Heavy rainfall may lead to minor localized flooding of small creeks and low-lying areas. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
